instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.C1950: What is C1950? Capacitor between PP3V42_G3H & ground on pin 8 of U1950 on 2013-2015 Macbook Pros & Airs that often corrodes. When corroded, pin 8 on U1950 will be damaged, which will prevent machine from booting and cause PM_SLP_S4_L to pulse. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not coming on, green light
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with damage <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pin 12 (pp3v42), replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and corrected all other burned caps and resistors

also damage around SMC , <CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR>, L5001, <CAPACITOR>C5001</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C5020</CAPACITOR>, REPLACED ALL and also replaced SMC with known working, 

there was damaged at <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, replaced also <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR>

There was damage at <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, Replaced also <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR>



<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42v

PPBUS G3H 1.5v 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> 1.5v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> 1.5v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42v

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.39v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 1.76v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 0.49v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> 0V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not coming on, green light
threads.message:
"PPBUS G3H 1.5v"
Missing mother of all secondary voltages.
Why continue measuring other voltages then?
Only 3V42 is independent, and present in this case.

Post diode mode to ground at F7140.
If strange value, renove it and see which pin.

Also post exact resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not coming on, green light
threads.message: [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] ?Also post exact resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>? please tell me , you usually ask for this , what?s the intended? Would low resistance here point to a bad ISL or it?s needed for a different section of the circuit ( am trying to understand, do you usually need the details to confirm the healthiness of the ISL or something else , please educate me )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not coming on, green light
threads.message:
The purpose of the forum is to assist people on their repairs.
Many times I explain even WHY and HOW, but this cannot replace a training course...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not coming on, green light
threads.message: Look at the schematic and tell us WHY those pins are important. Hint, they both should be low resistance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not coming on, green light
threads.message:
diode mode to ground pin2-  1.94 & pin 1-goes back to .OL

resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 3.7ohms  and 27/28  20.5 ohms  of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not coming on, green light
threads.message:
"diode mode to ground pin2- 1.94"
You cannot get that reading with red probe at ground...

Post some voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 19, 20, 27.
Also check L7130 voltage removing F7140.
